page.title: 13SOUTHFIELD FARM SEAHOUSES
page.content: This farm trading as James S.Smith & Sons is a mixed farm of 420 acres (168 hectares). The crops are Grain (70% winter sown) 250 acres; Sheep, 440 ewes lambing at about 175%; Vegetables for marketing, 20 acres and a further 20 acres of Potato quota leased to another farmer. In addition there are 80 acres of permanent grass. The whole enterprise is worked by Mr.Smith himself with the help of only two full time employees, one a shepherd and the other a general farm worker. Casual labour is used for the harvesting of the vegetable crops and Contractors are used for grain harvesting and for making round bales. Equipment: 3 Tractors, 1 Industrial Loader and 1 conventional baler.
